meanings.definition: To move or rise rapidly and suddenly.
meanings.sent1: The car rocketed down the street.
meanings.sent2: The plane rocketed into the sky.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel rocketed up the tree, surprising the birds.
meanings.sent4: Her heart rocketed with excitement as she won the race.
meanings.sent5: The rocketed spaceship left a trail of fire in the night sky.

meanings.sent1: The population of the city rocketed in the last decade.
meanings.sent2: The prices of houses rocketed due to high demand.
meanings.sent3: The cake rocketed in the oven, surprising the baker.
meanings.sent4: Her fame rocketed after the release of her hit song.
meanings.sent5: The plants rocketed in size after the rainy season.

meanings.definition: To propel or launch with great force.
meanings.sent1: The astronaut rocketed into space with a loud roar.
meanings.sent2: The fireworks rocketed into the night sky.
meanings.sent3: The baseball rocketed out of the park, surprising the fans.
meanings.sent4: The stone rocketed from the slingshot, hitting the target.
meanings.sent5: The roller coaster rocketed down the track, thrilling the riders.
